projects: [{"title":"In Search of the Recipe for Hit Songs: Predicting Hit Songs Using Machine Learning","start_date":"Apr 2022","end_date":"May 2023","description":"Advised by Professor Elizaveta Rebrova. Formulated a 100 page machine learning research thesis over a year-long period. Applied multiple regression algorithms (logistic, LASSO, and elastic net), along with Decision Tree and Random Forest models, to a large-scale music data set (Million Song Dataset) and implemented K-fold cross validation for optimal model hyperparameters. Evaluated all 5 models using various classification metrics and identified the relative significance of metadata features compared to audio features in predicting hit song potential with 83% accuracy. Received an A for final senior thesis grade."},{"title":"Excessive Positivity in the Sharing Economy: A Case Study with Airbnb Data in 5 US Cities","start_date":"Feb 2021","end_date":"May 2021","description":"Advised by Professor Daisy Yan Huang. Designed semester-long project and completed independent research to produce 30 page report which applies machine learning/regression methods to pinpoint different underlying factors that contribute to a high number of positive reviews on Airbnb. Utilized Random Forest in R for feature selection from 50+ features, applied sentiment analysis using VADER in Python, and trained 4 LASSO regression models in R until an efficient champion model was found."},{"title":"Optimism and Employment Success at Harambee","start_date":"Jan 2021","end_date":"Jan 2021","description":"Completed social impact project in Python and worked in a team of 3 to develop metrics, identify patterns, and derive data-based evidence from survey results to inform an international youth employment accelerator's program management where to target resources for extended involvement."},{"title":"B^2: Budgeting for Beginners","start_date":"Jul 2020","end_date":"Jul 2020","description":"A minimum viable product of a mobile investing app, powered by machine learning, that utilizes market research and the users' financial aspirations to allow for efficient investment."},{"title":"Choplery","start_date":"Dec 2019","end_date":"Jan 2020","description":"An eco friendly alternative, centered around tackling plastic waste, for everyday utensils. Transforming between chopsticks, a knife, a fork, a spoon, and a straw, this product revolutionizes how an individual goes about eating their meals. Created a business model, designs, and 3d model with Creo in team of 3."}]

honors_and_awards.title: John C. Bogle '51 Fellows in Civic Service
honors_and_awards.description: One of twenty three Princeton first-year students selected for funding to pursue a self-designed summer internship project focused on civic service.

honors_and_awards.title: Noble Math Aficionado Award
honors_and_awards.description: Nogales High School's Math Department recognizes one senior (from graduating class of approx. 430 students) who has demonstrated strong enthusiasm in the subject throughout his/her high school career.

honors_and_awards.title: Edison STEM Scholar
honors_and_awards.description: A $40,000 scholarship is awarded to thirty high school seniors who are empowered to innovate change through STEM.

honors_and_awards.title: Horatio Alger National Scholar
honors_and_awards.description: This $25,000 scholarship is annually awarded to 106 high school students throughout the nation who have faced and overcame obstacles in their young lives.

honors_and_awards.title: Quest for Excellence STEM Award
honors_and_awards.description: Achieving, low-income high school juniors with career interests in STEM are chosen for this award.

honors_and_awards.title: Hope of America
honors_and_awards.description: The Hope of America award recognizes students for their leadership and character.
